meanings.definition: Resembling or having the characteristics of a leaf.
meanings.sent1: The foliose plant in the garden swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted a foliose tree with intricate details on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The foliose plant tried to blend in with the real leaves but stood out with its bright colors.
meanings.sent4: Her hair cascaded down her back like a foliose waterfall of green strands.
meanings.sent5: The foliose texture of the fabric added a unique touch to the dress.

meanings.definition: Having a leaf-like appearance or structure.
meanings.sent1: The foliose pattern on the wallpaper brought a touch of nature into the room.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar camouflaged itself among the foliose leaves to avoid predators.
meanings.sent3: The foliose design on the cake made it look like a miniature forest.
meanings.sent4: Her dress shimmered in the sunlight, resembling a foliose canopy above her.
meanings.sent5: The foliose edges of the book pages fluttered in the wind as she turned them.
